Intents.description: user input related to the spreadsheet table
utterances that change the content of the table data
user input visualizing or styling a figure or report
connected to chit chat or other conversational nature

Dacts.description: occurs when the user wants to know more about the available columns or other meta-data
means to limit the rows returned to match a criteria or range of values
is segmenting or grouping the data in some fashion, including pivot tables
refers to sorting a column to establish order or ranking, frequently to find top values
calculation of a specific metric such as LTV, Retention, or ROAS. Usually a multi-turn process. Requires a metric as a slot value.
inserting information into the table, such as new columns, likely referencing other cells through a formula
update the values, including transforms on data type (ie. currency or datetime)
is removing or hiding rows or columns, often based on some criteria
style the contents, such as resizing column width, changing fonts or aligning text
means creating a figure, chart or diagram from the data
is any design or formatting elements to update an existing figure or chart
is to write out any text, such as summarizing information presented within a figure
is talking about non-data related subjects, so the response does not need to query the table. Answers may be based on opinion, and can change for one person to another.
is getting a better understanding of what the service entails, answering questions found in a FAQ. Unlike 'chat', the answers to 'help' questions are broadly applicable to all customers.
asking for clarification about what the agent said or did. These utterances always include a target entity for inquiry
query with filtering and grouping: 'Show total dress shoes sold per month'
query with filtering and sorting: 'What are the most expensive basketball shoes?'
query with grouping and sorting: 'Who are the top sales reps in each region?'
filter, group and sort together: 'Find the top selling running shoes for each city'
making and modifying pivot tables, including range and column selection
requesting guidance on multi-step analysis, such as Cohort Analysis, A/B Testing evaluation, or Multi-touch attribution.
performing exploratory analysis for the purpose of identifying noisy example, such as outliers or anomalies
applying analysis to existing plot or diagram, namely trendlines or clustering
performing the same analysis on the next item: 'OK, how about the next one'
going back to the last step: 'Nevermind, undo that'
acknowledging progress in positive manner: 'Nice, this looks good'
creating and managing dashboard, such as automatic updates
creating and managing reports, such as weekly recurring generation
expressing confusion about next steps: 'I don't know what to do next'
generic questions about the spreadsheet: 'Any interesting insights in this data?'
